alert.note: Alert for West Carroll (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 2:17PM CDT until March 30 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MOREHOUSE...NORTHEASTERN RICHLAND...WEST CARROLL AND NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN PARISHES... At 217 PM CDT, tornado producing storms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Wilmot to near Darnell to near Bakers, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These tornadic storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Morehouse, northeastern Richland, West Carroll and northeastern Franklin Parishes, including the following locations... Pioneer and Epps. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
